original: RECITALS WHEREAS,  SINA Corporation, a company organized under the laws of the Cayman Islands (“ SINA”), and CRIC Holdings Limited, a company organized under the laws of the Cayman Islands (“ CRIC”), entered into that certain Share Purchase Agreement dated July 23, 2009 (the “ Share Purchase Agreement ”), pursuant to which SINA subscribes from CRIC the Subscription Shares (as defined in the Share Purchase Agreement); WHEREAS,  Licensor is the registrant of certain domain names as more particularly described below that are related to the Business which it desires to license to Licensee and Licensee desires to obtain a license from Licensor to such domain names to use in connection with its operation of the Business on the terms and conditions set forth herein; and WHEREAS , Licensor and Shanghai SINA Leju Information Technology Co. Ltd. (“ SINA Leju ”) entered into that certain Domain Name License Agreement dated May 8, 2008 (the “ Original Agreement ”) and (i) Licensor and SINA Leju desire to terminate the Original Agreement pursuant to the Mutual Termination Agreement attached hereto as  Exhibit B and (ii) Licensee and Licensor desire to enter into this Agreement, on or prior to the consummation of the transactions contemplated by the Share Purchase Agreement.
ollama_generated: RECITALS WHEREAS, SINA Corporation, a company organized under the laws of the Cayman Islands ("SINA"), and CRIC Holdings Limited, a company organized under the laws of the Cayman Islands ("CRIC"), entered into that certain Share Purchase Agreement dated July 23, 2009 (the "Share Purchase Agreement") pursuant to which SINA subscribed from CRIC the Subscription Shares (as defined in the Share Purchase Agreement); WHEREAS, Licensor is the registrant of certain domain names as more particularly described below that are related to a business which it has agreed to make available for licensing to Licensee and Licensee has expressed its intent to acquire a license from Licensor to use such domain names in relation to its proposed operation of the business on the terms and conditions set forth herein, subject to Licensor's agreement; AND WHEREAS, Licensor and Shanghai SINA Leju Information Technology Co. Ltd. (“SINA Leju”) have previously entered into that certain Domain Name License Agreement dated May 8, 2008 (the “Original Agreement”), and (i) Licensor and SINA Leju are in the process of mutually terminating the Original Agreement pursuant to the Mutual Termination Agreement attached hereto as Exhibit B, and (ii) Licensee and Licensor express their intention to enter into this Agreement, only following the consummation of the transactions contemplated by the Share Purchase Agreement.

original: ARTICLE I DEFINITIONS As used herein, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE I. INTERPRETATION OF TERMS

For the purposes of this Agreement, the definitions provided below shall govern the interpretation of the following terms:

1. "Party" shall refer collectively to [Company Name] and its successors or assigns, and to the individual(s) or entity(ies) who/which execute this Agreement on behalf of [Recipient's Name].

2. "Agreement" refers to this entire document, including all its attached exhibits, schedules, and any amendments thereto, made in accordance with its terms.

3. "Confidential Information" means any non-public information disclosed by one Party to the other that is marked as confidential or should reasonably be considered confidential under the circumstances of disclosure. However, Confidential Information shall not include information that is: (i) publicly known at the time of disclosure; (ii) subsequently becomes publicly known through no fault of the receiving Party; (iii) rightfully obtained by the receiving Party from a third party without breach of any obligation of confidentiality; or (iv) independently developed by the receiving Party.

4. "Breach" shall be interpreted as any material violation of this Agreement by either Party, including but not limited to: (i) failure to perform any material obligations under this Agreement; (ii) disclosure or use of Confidential Information in violation of this Agreement; or (iii) failure to timely remedy a material breach after written notice.

5. "Default" shall be understood as the occurrence of an event that would constitute a breach if not promptly remedied by the defaulting Party, and includes but is not limited to situations where: (i) any payment obligation under this Agreement remains unfulfilled for more than thirty (30) days after its due date; (ii) there occurs a material adverse change in the financial condition of either Party; or (iii) either Party terminates this Agreement without cause.

6. "Term" denotes the period beginning on the Effective Date and ending on the expiration or earlier termination of this Agreement, as specified in Section VIII herein.

original: “Change of Control ” means (i) the consummation of any acquisition or purchase, directly or indirectly, by any Person or related group of Persons, that results in a Competitor owning more ordinary shares in CRIC than E-House and SINA, and in each case, their respective controlled Affiliates, own in the aggregate or (ii) an event pursuant to which a Competitor acquires the right to nominate a member to the board of directors of CRIC .

(c) Despite any provisions in this Agreement to the contrary, Licensor retains the exclusive right to determine whether any sub-license of the rights granted herein to third parties is permissible. original: 2.3.  Fees. In the event E-House Research and Training Institute becomes entitled to charge, invoice, or otherwise receive from, Licensee any royalties, fees or other remuneration for use of the E-House Licensed Data and Information pursuant to amendments to the Master Transaction Agreement or through other means, Licensor  and Licensee shall use good faith efforts to  amend this Agreement such that Licensor becomes entitled to charge, invoice, or otherwise receive fees from Licensee to use the Licensed Domain Names and Licensed Content, such fees to be agreed upon by the Parties,  provided that (i) such fees shall be commercially reasonable and (ii) such fees shall not exceed the fees charged by Licensor to unaffiliated third parties for use of the Licensed Content, taking into account any other consideration received by Licensor (including, but not limited to, discounted services offerings from the third party).
ollama_generated: 2.3. Fees Adjustment. In the event that Licensee is required to pay royalties, fees, or remuneration to E-House Research and Training Institute for the use of the E-House Licensed Data and Information, either under amendments to the Master Transaction Agreement or other means, Licensor and Licensee shall make good faith efforts to modify this Agreement so that the Licensor may charge, invoice, or receive fees from Licensee for using the Licensed Domain Names and Licensed Content. The agreed-upon fees shall be reasonable but not exceed the fees Licensor charges to unrelated third parties for using the Licensed Content, considering any other benefits received by Licensor (such as discounted services) from the third party. In this case, the Licensor's right to collect such fees takes precedence over any previously agreed fees or fee structures in this Agreement.

original: ARTICLE III QUALITY CONTROL 3.1.  Licensee Control . Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Licensee shall be entitled to exercise exclusive control over all aspects of the websites and the Business associated with the Licensed Domain Names including, without limitation, the operation, the look-and-feel and the Content of such websites.
modified:
ARTICLE III QUALITY CONTROL
3.1. Licensor's Oversight. Pursuant to the provisions of this Agreement, Licensor shall have the right, but not the obligation, to oversee all facets of the websites and the Business pertaining to the Licensed Domain Names, including, without limitation, their operation, aesthetics, and content. Any such oversight shall be exercised in a non-interfering manner, and Licensor shall not unreasonably restrict Licensee's discretion or decision-making authority.

This revision weakens the obligation of the Licensee to control all aspects of the websites and the Business associated with the Licensed Domain Names by introducing an optional nature to the Licensor's oversight and a non-interfering role for the Licensor. The revised clause also emphasizes that the Licensor will not unreasonably restrict the Licensee's discretion or decision-making authority.

original: (b) By Licensee . Licensee may terminate this Agreement at any time in the event that the Licensor is in material default or breach of any provision of this Agreement, and, if such default or breach is capable of cure, such default or breach continues uncured for a period of thirty (30) days after receipt of written notice thereof;  provided, however, that in the event that the Licensor has in good faith commenced cure within such thirty (30) day period, but cannot practically complete such cure within such thirty (30) day period, the Parties shall negotiate a reasonable additional time to cure.
ollama_generated: (b) By the Licensee: The Licensor grants the Licensee the right to terminate this Agreement at any given moment, should the Licensor materially default or breach any terms of this Agreement. If such default or breach is curable, and the Licensor begins the remediation process within the thirty (30) day period following written notification, but is unable to complete the cure within that timeframe due to practical constraints, both parties shall engage in discussions aimed at establishing a reasonable extension for the rectification. In such instances, the termination right of the Licensee shall be suspended until the additional curative time has been agreed upon and enacted.

original: (a) Upon termination (but not expiration) of this Agreement for any reason, Licensee shall be entitled to use the Licensed Domain Names and Licensed Content for a limited period of time, not to exceed ninety (90) days, during which it shall diligently work to transition to another solution.  Upon expiration of this Agreement or such 90-day period, (i) all rights granted to Licensee under this Agreement with respect to the Licensed Domain Names and Licensed Content shall immediately cease, and (ii) Licensee shall immediately discontinue all use of the Licensed Domain Names and Licensed Content.
modified:
(a) Upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement for any reason, the Licensor shall grant the Licensee a limited, non-exclusive right to continue using the Licensed Domain Names and Licensed Content for a period not exceeding ninety (90) days. This permission is conditioned on the understanding that during this transitional phase, the Licensee will make every reasonable effort to establish an alternative solution as expeditiously as practicable.

Following the expiration of the Agreement or the 90-day period, whichever comes first: (i) the Licensor shall retain no further obligations with respect to the Licensed Domain Names and Licensed Content, and all rights previously granted to the Licensee under this Agreement regarding these elements shall be deemed null and void, and (ii) it shall be the responsibility of the Licensee to promptly cease any and all use of the Licensed Domain Names and Licensed Content.

original: ARTICLE IX CONFIDENTIALITY 9.1.  Confidential Information . In performing its obligations under this Agreement, either Party (the “ Recipient ”) may obtain certain Confidential Information of the other Party.  For purposes of this Agreement, “ Confidential Information ” shall mean information, documents and other tangible things, provided by either Party to the other, in whatever form, relating to such Party’s business and marketing, including such Source: LEJU HOLDINGS LTD, DRS (on F-1), 1/21/2014 Party’s financial information, personal information, customer lists, product plans and marketing plans, whether alone or in its compiled form and whether marked as confidential or not.  The Recipient shall maintain in Source: LEJU HOLDINGS LTD, DRS (on F-1), 1/21/2014 confidence all Confidential Information and shall not disclose such Confidential Information to any third party without the express written consent of the other Party except to those of its employees, subcontractors, consultants, representatives and agents as are necessary in connection with activities as contemplated by this Agreement.  In maintaining the confidentiality of Confidential Information, the Recipient shall exercise the same degree of care that it exercises with its own confidential information, and in no event less than a reasonable degree of care.  The Recipient shall ensure that each of its employees, subcontractors, consultants, representatives and agents holds in confidence and makes no use of the Confidential Information for any purpose other than those permitted under this Agreement or otherwise required by Law.  Upon request by the other Party, the Recipient shall return, destroy or otherwise handle as instructed by the other Party, any documents or software containing such Confidential Information, and shall not continue to use such Confidential Information.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE IX CONFIDENTIALITY

9.1.  Confidentiality Obligations. Under the terms of this Agreement, either Party (the " Receiver ") may receive certain Confidential Materials from the other Party (the " Discloser "). As used in this Agreement, " Confidential Materials " shall encompass any information, documents, or other tangible items disclosed by one Party to the other, regardless of form and whether explicitly marked as confidential or not. This includes but is not limited to the Discloser's business and marketing strategies, financial data, personal information, customer lists, product plans, and marketing plans.

9.2.  Duty to Protect. The Receiver shall safeguard all Confidential Materials and shall only disclose such materials to third parties with the written consent of the Discloser, except as necessary for its own employees, subcontractors, consultants, representatives, and agents in carrying out activities contemplated by this Agreement.

9.3.  Standard of Care. In safeguarding Confidential Materials, the Receiver shall exercise a degree of care that is reasonable under the circumstances, but no less than the degree of care it employs for its own confidential information. Each of the Receiver's employees, subcontractors, consultants, representatives, and agents are expected to adhere to this standard when handling Confidential Materials.

9.4.  Use Limitations. The Receiver shall use Confidential Materials solely for purposes permitted under this Agreement or as required by law.

9.5.  Return or Destruction. Upon the Discloser's request, the Receiver shall return, destroy, or otherwise dispose of any documents or software containing Confidential Materials in accordance with the Discloser's instructions. The Receiver shall not retain any copies or continue to use such Confidential Materials.

original: 9.2.  Exceptions . The obligation of confidentiality contained in Section 9.1 shall not apply to the extent that (a) the Recipient is required to disclose information by order or regulation of a Governmental Authority or a court of competent jurisdiction;  provided, however, that, to the extent permitted by applicable Law, the Recipient shall not make any such disclosure without first notifying the other Party and allowing the other Party a reasonable opportunity to seek injunctive relief from (or a protective order with respect to) the obligation to make such disclosure; or (b) the Recipient can demonstrate that (i) the disclosed information was at the time of such disclosure to the Recipient already in (or thereafter enters) the public domain other than as a result of actions of the Recipient, its directors, officers, employees or agents in violation hereof, (ii) the disclosed information was rightfully known to the Recipient prior to the date of disclosure (other than pursuant to disclosure by the other Party pursuant to other agreements in effect between the Parties), or (iii) the disclosed information was received by the Recipient on an unrestricted basis from a source unrelated to any Party and not under a duty of confidentiality to the other Party.

SINA Corporation, located at 20/F Beijing Ideal International Plaza, No. 58 Northwest 4th Ring Road, Haidian District, Beijing, 100090, People's Republic of China (Facsimile: +86 10 8260 7166). Primary contact for this agreement is the Head of Legal Department (Xie Guomin), although copies may also be sent to other parties without serving as notice.

This revision weakens the obligation by stating that sending copies of the agreement does not constitute notice, meaning additional recipients do not need to respond or take action based on receiving the document.
